posts.name: wesbass23
posts.cooked: I have not used this featurescript personally but check out Getting Started | Onshape4FRC and scroll down to the section “adding useful featurescripts” It lists a number of useful featurescripts as well as how to add them.

posts.name: Moataz_azaiza
posts.cooked: It is a feature used to draw a belt between the pulleys

posts.name: Patrick Hughes
posts.cooked:
Are you looking for a basic visualization of a belt? Or are you looking a featurescript that generates the actuator belt profile?

Julia’s Featurescripts is a great resource and in document linked she has a contextless Belt generator that creates a great visual and if you choose the pulley size and points, it can give you the belt length and tooth count within the part name. However, it does not give you the profile. This is also linked in the Onshape4FRC as Wes linked earlier.

If you want to to create the belt profile to say print on a 3D printer, you can use this link here Parametric Pulley Belt by Vivalize - Thingiverse , If you sign into thingiverse and use the customizer feature you can put in the parameters required and you can generate a belt 3D model that is able to be printed, however it is that great for using with in the model as it generates it as a proper circle which is required for it to print properly.

link_counts.title: Parametric Pulley Belt by Vivalize - Thingiverse

posts.name: Moataz_azaiza
posts.cooked: I want to create sketch for belt and after that to do part belt Who did you extract it from the sketch , i am hear for feture belt in line the features  but I don’t know how i add this future

posts.name: paulonis
posts.cooked:
Log in to Onshape.

Open Julia’s Featurescripts

Click Custom features image 1627×182 22.5 KB

image 1627×182 22.5 KB

image 1627×182 22.5 KB

In the pop-up menu open the Belts item and click on Contextless Belt to add it to your Onshape account

You can do the same thing for Belt & Pulley Gen from 2471 Featurescripts .  This one works differently and you may prefer it in some situations.
